## üéØ Overview

The Tabs component is a professional-grade, accessible tabbed interface built with React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. It provides a clean and intuitive way to organize content into multiple panels that can be switched between using tab triggers.

### Key Features

- ‚úÖ **Full Accessibility Support** - ARIA compliant with keyboard navigation
- ‚úÖ **Multiple Variants** - Line, subtle, enclosed, outline, and plain styles
- ‚úÖ **Color Palettes** - 6 predefined color schemes
- ‚úÖ **Responsive Design** - Works on all screen sizes
- ‚úÖ **Icon Support** - Easy integration with icons
- ‚úÖ **Lazy Loading** - Performance optimization for large tab sets
- ‚úÖ **Deselectable Tabs** - Optional tab deselection
- ‚úÖ **Controlled & Uncontrolled** - Flexible state management
- ‚úÖ **TypeScript Support** - Full type safety

## üì¶ Installation

```bash
npm install @acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds
```

```tsx
import { Tabs } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

## üöÄ Basic Usage

### Simple Tabs

```tsx
import { Tabs } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function MyComponent() {
  return (
    <Tabs defaultValue="tab-1">
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="tab-3">Tab 3</Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">
          <div>Content for Tab 1</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">
          <div>Content for Tab 2</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="tab-3">
          <div>Content for Tab 3</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

### With Icons

```tsx
import { Tabs } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
import { Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function MyComponent() {
  return (
    <Tabs defaultValue="home">
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="home">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-3">home</Icon>
          Home
        </Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="search">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-3">search</Icon>
          Search
        </Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="profile">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-3">person</Icon>
          Profile
        </Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="home">
          <div>Home content</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="search">
          <div>Search content</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="profile">
          <div>Profile content</div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

## üèóÔ∏è Component API

The Tabs component follows a compound component pattern with the following structure:

```tsx
<Tabs>
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="...">...</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Indicator /> {/* Optional */}
  </Tabs.List>
  <Tabs.Panels>
    <Tabs.Panel value="...">...</Tabs.Panel>
  </Tabs.Panels>
</Tabs>
```

### Component Hierarchy

- **`Tabs`** - Root component that manages state and context
- **`Tabs.List`** - Container for tab triggers
- **`Tabs.Tab`** - Individual tab trigger button
- **`Tabs.Panels`** - Container for tab content panels
- **`Tabs.Panel`** - Individual tab content panel
- **`Tabs.Indicator`** - Visual indicator for active tab (optional)

## üìù Props Reference

### Tabs (Root Component)

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `value` | `string \| null` | - | Controlled value of the active tab |
| `defaultValue` | `string` | - | Uncontrolled default value |
| `onValueChange` | `(value: string \| null) => void` | - | Callback when tab changes |
| `variant` | `'line' \| 'subtle' \| 'enclosed' \| 'outline' \| 'plain'` | `'line'` | Visual style variant |
| `size` | `'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg'` | `'md'` | Size of tabs and panels |
| `colorPalette` | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info'` | `'primary'` | Color scheme |
| `orientation` | `'horizontal' \| 'vertical'` | `'horizontal'` | Tab orientation |
| `activationMode` | `'automatic' \| 'manual'` | `'automatic'` | How tabs are activated |
| `lazyMount` | `boolean` | `false` | Lazy load tab content |
| `unmountOnExit` | `boolean` | `false` | Unmount inactive tabs |
| `loopFocus` | `boolean` | `true` | Loop focus when navigating with keyboard |
| `deselectable` | `boolean` | `false` | Allow deselecting active tab |
| `fitted` | `boolean` | `false` | Make tabs equal width |
| `justify` | `'start' \| 'center' \| 'end' \| 'between' \| 'around' \| 'evenly'` | `'start'` | Justify tabs within list |
| `className` | `string` | - | Additional CSS classes |
| `as` | `React.ElementType` | `'div'` | HTML element to render as |

### Tabs.Tab

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `value` | `string` | - | Unique value for this tab |
| `disabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Disable the tab |
| `className` | `string` | - | Additional CSS classes |
| `onClick` | `(event: MouseEvent) => void` | - | Click handler |
| `onFocus` | `(event: FocusEvent) => void` | - | Focus handler |
| `asChild` | `boolean` | `false` | Render as child element |

### Tabs.Panel

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `value` | `string` | - | Value that matches the corresponding tab |
| `className` | `string` | - | Additional CSS classes |
| `asChild` | `boolean` | `false` | Render as child element |

## üé® Variants

### Line (Default)
Clean underline indicator for active tab.

```tsx
<Tabs variant="line">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Subtle
Background color change for active tab.

```tsx
<Tabs variant="subtle">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Enclosed
Card-like appearance with borders.

```tsx
<Tabs variant="enclosed">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Outline
Bordered tabs with rounded corners.

```tsx
<Tabs variant="outline">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Plain
Minimal styling with no borders or backgrounds.

```tsx
<Tabs variant="plain">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

## üåà Color Palettes

### Primary (Default)
Uses the brand orange color scheme.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="primary">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Secondary
Uses neutral gray colors.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="secondary">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Success
Uses green colors for success states.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="success">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Warning
Uses yellow/orange colors for warning states.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="warning">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Danger
Uses red colors for error/danger states.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="danger">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Info
Uses blue colors for informational states.

```tsx
<Tabs colorPalette="info">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

## üìè Sizes

### Small (sm)
Compact tabs for dense interfaces.

```tsx
<Tabs size="sm">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Medium (md) - Default
Standard size for most use cases.

```tsx
<Tabs size="md">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### Large (lg)
Larger tabs for prominent interfaces.

```tsx
<Tabs size="lg">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

## ‚ö° Advanced Features

### Controlled Tabs

```tsx
import { useState } from 'react';

function ControlledTabs() {
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('tab-1');

  return (
    <Tabs value={activeTab} onValueChange={setActiveTab}>
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">Content 2</Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

### Lazy Loading

```tsx
<Tabs lazyMount>
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  <Tabs.Panels>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">
      {/* This content loads immediately */}
      <div>Immediate content</div>
    </Tabs.Panel>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">
      {/* This content loads only when tab is first selected */}
      <div>Lazy loaded content</div>
    </Tabs.Panel>
  </Tabs.Panels>
</Tabs>
```

### Deselectable Tabs

```tsx
<Tabs deselectable>
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  <Tabs.Panels>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">Content 2</Tabs.Panel>
  </Tabs.Panels>
</Tabs>
```

### Disabled Tabs

```tsx
<Tabs>
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Enabled Tab</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2" disabled>Disabled Tab</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-3">Another Enabled Tab</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  <Tabs.Panels>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">This won't be accessible</Tabs.Panel>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-3">Content 3</Tabs.Panel>
  </Tabs.Panels>
</Tabs>
```

### Fitted Tabs

```tsx
<Tabs fitted>
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Short</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Much Longer Tab Name</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-3">Medium</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  {/* Tabs will have equal width */}
</Tabs>
```

### Vertical Orientation

```tsx
<Tabs orientation="vertical">
  <Tabs.List>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
    <Tabs.Tab value="tab-2">Tab 2</Tabs.Tab>
  </Tabs.List>
  <Tabs.Panels>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>
    <Tabs.Panel value="tab-2">Content 2</Tabs.Panel>
  </Tabs.Panels>
</Tabs>
```

## ‚ôø Accessibility

The Tabs component is fully accessible and follows ARIA guidelines:

### Keyboard Navigation

- **Tab**: Move focus between tabs
- **Arrow Keys**: Navigate between tabs (horizontal: left/right, vertical: up/down)
- **Home/End**: Jump to first/last tab
- **Enter/Space**: Activate focused tab
- **Escape**: Deselect active tab (if deselectable)

### ARIA Attributes

- `role="tablist"` on the tab list
- `role="tab"` on each tab
- `role="tabpanel"` on each panel
- `aria-selected` indicates active tab
- `aria-disabled` indicates disabled tab
- `aria-controls` links tabs to panels

### Screen Reader Support

- Tab names are announced when focused
- Active state is clearly communicated
- Panel content is associated with its tab

## üí° Examples

### Dashboard Navigation

```tsx
function Dashboard() {
  return (
    <Tabs defaultValue="overview" variant="line" size="lg">
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="overview">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-2">dashboard</Icon>
          Overview
        </Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="analytics">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-2">analytics</Icon>
          Analytics
        </Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="settings">
          <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-2">settings</Icon>
          Settings
        </Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="overview">
          <div className="p-6">
            <h2>Dashboard Overview</h2>
            {/* Dashboard content */}
          </div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="analytics">
          <div className="p-6">
            <h2>Analytics</h2>
            {/* Analytics content */}
          </div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="settings">
          <div className="p-6">
            <h2>Settings</h2>
            {/* Settings content */}
          </div>
        </Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

### Form Wizard

```tsx
function FormWizard() {
  const [currentStep, setCurrentStep] = useState('step-1');

  return (
    <Tabs value={currentStep} onValueChange={setCurrentStep} variant="enclosed">
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="step-1">Personal Info</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="step-2">Contact Details</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="step-3">Preferences</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="step-4">Review</Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="step-1">
          <PersonalInfoForm />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="step-2">
          <ContactDetailsForm />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="step-3">
          <PreferencesForm />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="step-4">
          <ReviewForm />
        </Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

### Settings Panel

```tsx
function SettingsPanel() {
  return (
    <Tabs defaultValue="general" variant="subtle" colorPalette="primary">
      <Tabs.List>
        <Tabs.Tab value="general">General</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="notifications">Notifications</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="privacy">Privacy</Tabs.Tab>
        <Tabs.Tab value="advanced">Advanced</Tabs.Tab>
      </Tabs.List>
      <Tabs.Panels>
        <Tabs.Panel value="general">
          <GeneralSettings />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="notifications">
          <NotificationSettings />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="privacy">
          <PrivacySettings />
        </Tabs.Panel>
        <Tabs.Panel value="advanced">
          <AdvancedSettings />
        </Tabs.Panel>
      </Tabs.Panels>
    </Tabs>
  );
}
```

## ‚úÖ Best Practices

### 1. Use Descriptive Tab Labels
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Good
<Tabs.Tab value="user-profile">User Profile</Tabs.Tab>

// ‚ùå Avoid
<Tabs.Tab value="tab1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
```

### 2. Keep Tab Content Focused
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Good - Each panel has a single purpose
<Tabs.Panel value="settings">
  <SettingsForm />
</Tabs.Panel>

// ‚ùå Avoid - Mixing unrelated content
<Tabs.Panel value="mixed">
  <SettingsForm />
  <UserProfile />
  <Analytics />
</Tabs.Panel>
```

### 3. Use Icons Consistently
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Good - Consistent icon usage
<Tabs.Tab value="home">
  <Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-2">home</Icon>
  Home
</Tabs.Tab>

// ‚ùå Avoid - Inconsistent spacing or sizing
<Tabs.Tab value="search">
  <Icon className="w-5 h-5 mr-1">search</Icon>
  Search
</Tabs.Tab>
```

### 4. Consider Mobile Experience
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Good - Responsive design
<Tabs variant="line" size="sm" className="md:size-md">
  {/* ... */}
</Tabs>
```

### 5. Use Lazy Loading for Heavy Content
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Good - Lazy load heavy content
<Tabs lazyMount>
  <Tabs.Panel value="heavy-content">
    <HeavyDataVisualization />
  </Tabs.Panel>
</Tabs>
```

## üîß Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. Icons Not Spacing Correctly
**Problem**: Icons appear too close to text.

**Solution**: Ensure you're using the correct margin classes:
```tsx
<Icon className="w-4 h-4 mr-3">{iconName}</Icon>
```

#### 2. Tabs Not Responding to Clicks
**Problem**: Tabs don't change when clicked.

**Solution**: Check that `value` props match between tabs and panels:
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Correct
<Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
<Tabs.Panel value="tab-1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>

// ‚ùå Incorrect
<Tabs.Tab value="tab-1">Tab 1</Tabs.Tab>
<Tabs.Panel value="tab1">Content 1</Tabs.Panel>
```

#### 3. Styling Not Applied
**Problem**: Custom styles not appearing.

**Solution**: Ensure Tailwind classes are included in your build:
```js
// tailwind.config.js
module.exports = {
  content: [
    './src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
    './node_modules/@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}'
  ]
}
```

#### 4. Accessibility Issues
**Problem**: Screen readers not announcing tab changes.

**Solution**: Ensure proper ARIA attributes are present:
```tsx
<Tabs onValueChange={(value) => {
  // Announce tab changes to screen readers
  const announcement = `Switched to ${value} tab`;
  // Use your preferred announcement method
}}>
```

### Performance Tips

1. **Use Lazy Loading**: For tabs with heavy content
2. **Avoid Unnecessary Re-renders**: Use `useMemo` for expensive computations
3. **Optimize Icons**: Use consistent icon sizes and consider icon fonts

### Browser Support

- Chrome 90+
- Firefox 88+
- Safari 14+
- Edge 90+
